pages.text: Eggs are fairly straightforward. Most eggs can be placed on the ground, in that case moss, wool, or hay blocks are ideal for quicker incubation. Some eggs must be placed on or under water, and some can simply be thrown like a chicken egg.

Embryos are a little different. They require a vessel to be incubated inside of, which is where Living Ooze comes into play. A Living Ooze can be created by simply filling a cauldron with Organic Ooze until full, then picking it up with a bucket. Then place the ooze into the world and insert the embryo into it and wait for it to spit out the baby!

After incubating an embryo, the ooze will go on a temporary cooldown indicated by its facial expression and shaking body. Living Ooze can pick up any item off the ground or be given any item. They are also quite resilient, being able to survive on land just as well as in water.
